item.title: Multiple Causes
item.description: The credibility revolution of the past decades in Economics and the social sciences in general has had a tremendous impact. Everyone talks about identification strategies and causal effects, about treatments and various treatment effects. I laud this general development, though in my opinion it has also led many research agendas to be guided by fairly reductionist accounts of causality. We are looking for THE causal effect from education to income, from THE causal effect from institutions to economic growth, from THE causal effect from x to y.

item.title: Research Statement
item.description: This document is a work in progress trying to capture my research agenda and underlying research philosophy. I do not believe that Science evolves linearly and while I believe it is generally laudible to be driven by fundamental, society-relevant questions, I also believe that a lot of progress in Science happens from applying new methods. My own research is thus a combination of being attracted to specific fundamental questions and specific methods.

item.title: Replicability I - Managing the workflow
item.description: In this post, I am going to introduce a few helpful tools to manage one’s workflow in R (specifically RStudio). While this serves as a reminder for myself, I still hope this is helpful for a few people. item.title: Research statement
item.description: Intro My research interests span across disciplines and subdisciplines. I am fundamentally interested in how societies change in the process of development. To understand this process of development better, my research focusses on three different angles. My primary research focus is on the political economy of development. I believe that a major determinant of processes of development is how political and economic institutions and actors intertwine. This relates not only to the focus of the literature on how political institutions and actors undermine the workings of the economy, coopt and distort the economy, but also to how economic changes impact the political system at different levels.
